comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
Can we be specific about what all means?
All rules active as per the business spec or all the rules that implment the IEligibilityRule?
This can be a critical piece of configuration so a correct documenttion with examples would be a plus for future use.

comments.comment: allActiveEligibilityRules? Or any other way to define it?

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Minimum Employees

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
The Java doc should be changed completely. We are having differnt rule implmentation for each Dropdown option.
So it should be specific to Minimum50EmployeesWithin75MilesEligibilityRule only.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
This Rule Def value could be take from the Plan configuration itself.
Maybe we can use: EmployeesRuleBasis.FIFTY_EMPLOYEES_WITHIN_SEVENTYFIVE_MILE_RADIUS
We got a confirmation from Carla too I guess..

comments.author: Mark Kevitt
comments.comment: No This is an Enmu and and enum offset. We need a string not a long.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Yes, and what I mean is: we could use the real String associated to this backed by the Enum long value. So in this case it would be "50 Employees within 75 miles of worksite". And we could get it by: selectedLeavePlan.getLeavePlan().getEligibilityRequirement().getEmployeesRuleBasis().getName()

comments.author: Mark Kevitt
Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Please keep a track of this to be implmented as a standard for all the MinEmployee Rule variants.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
1. Variable HOURS_WORKED_UNKNOWN_REASON should be given the right name.
2. Also we got a confirmation that the reason should be: "Number of employees within 75 miles unknown." Please replace that with the right value.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
We should avoid this doube check, because: 1. We are making sure this, before execution of this rule in the engine.
2. This rule should return a RuleEligibilityResult when it is executed. We assume that we are not handling any null RuleEligibilityResult. Hope we discussed this and I had given a clear explanation in one of my mail too.

comments.comment: As discussed we are keeping the check in the rule. I know it will never fail and return null. But let keep it safety check incase if we feel later that it is overhead we will remove.
